name: 70s Sports Quiz | USA by Year | 15 Questions

questions.text: What team snapped UCLA's 88 game winning streak in men's basketball in 1974?
questions.explanation:
Notre Dame.

	Notre Dame beat the Bruins 71-70 to break the streak.

questions.text: UCLA's 88 game winning streak began in 1970. Who did they last lose to before the streak began?
What New York Ranger goalie recorded his 103rd career shutout in 1970?
questions.explanation:
Terry Sawchuck.

	Sawchuck blanked Pittsburgh 6-0 to get his final shutout. He is the only goalie in NHL history with over 100 shutouts.

questions.text: Who was the first member of the Negro League to be inducted into the Baseball Hall of Fame?
questions.explanation:
Leroy Paige.

	Leroy 'Satchel' Paige was inducted to the Hall in 1971.

questions.text: What two teams played in the last American Football League championship game in 1970?
questions.correct: Kansas City Chiefs and Oakland Raiders
options: Kansas City Chiefs and Buffalo Bills
New York Jets and San Diego Chargers
questions.explanation:
Kansas City Chiefs and Oakland Raiders.

	The Chiefs beat the Raiders 17-7. The next year the AFL merged with the National Football League.

questions.text: What team ,in 1971, lost their first game in over 8 years after winning 2,495 consecutive games?
questions.explanation:
Harlem Globetrotters & Harlem & Globetrotters.

	The Harlem Globetrotters lost to the New Jersey Reds 100-99 on January 5th, 1971.

questions.text: Who became the first man to win the Daytona 500 six times with his victory in 1979?
questions.explanation:
Richard Petty.

	Petty won it a seventh time in 1992.

questions.text: Who did Magic Johnson's Michigan State Spartans defeat, to win the NCAA Division I men's basketball championship in 1979?
questions.explanation:
Indiana State University.

	Johnson led his Spartans to a 75-64 win over Larry Bird's Indiana State Sycamores.

questions.text: On April 8th, 1974 Hank Aaron hit his 715th home run breaking Babe Ruth's record. What pitcher gave up the home run?
questions.explanation:
Al Downing & Downing.

	Aaron lined Downing's second pitch of the at bat into the left field bullpen.

questions.text: Who tied a then Major League record by striking out 19 batters in a game in 1970?
questions.explanation:
Tom Seaver.

	Seaver struck out the last 10 Padres in the game securing a 2-1 win for the Mets.

questions.text: For what race did Janet Guthrie become the first woman to qualify for in 1977?
In 1977 and 1978 horse racing had its first back to back triple crown winners in history. Seattle Slew won it in 1977. Who won it in 1978?
On July 18th, 1976, who earned the first perfect score in Olympic gymnastics?
questions.explanation:
Nadia Comaneci.

	The 14 year old Romanian become a world celebrity with her perfect performance with 10 out of 10.

questions.text: How many gold medals did US swimmer Mark Spitz win at the 1972 Olympics?
questions.explanation:
7.

	Before then no one had won more than five.

questions.text: What was the name given to Franco Harris' miracle catch in 1972 that put the Pittsburgh Steelers in the AFC Championship game?
